topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541e0b2f63687257969f0100#post_541e0b2f63687257969f0100
In Aspropyrgos, a small town 18kms from Athens, the roads don't have bumps. they have fucking craters!!! And we have dirt roads which are lane wide on the edge of a cliff without barriers.

"@Background Pony #5CD1":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541e0cc263687217193f0000#post_541e0cc263687217193f0000
Whoa, dude, that's insane! How can vehicles even get by safely?!
topics.author: 5056c9e87f123b37f6012a34

topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541e0e0463687265e81f0100#post_541e0e0463687265e81f0100
Aspropyrgos is a bloody mess regarding it's roads,the kind you need to see for yourself to believe it. Even though I was exaggerating slightly for the craters(don't worry you will still find them crater-sized potholes), suspension and wheel breaking potholes are very common. And you will find these dirt roads in Agrafa, in central Greece but they have finally started to pave them.

You know what the best part of living alone is?
[spoiler]No one will say anything if I decide to take a nap.[/spoiler]

You know what the worst part of living alone is?
[spoiler]No one to interrupt my napping with a surprise blowjob.[/spoiler]
